body:
Happy Friday!

Just a quick note to let y'all know that we have updated all of the
Radiance binary installers, and they are available for download at the
NREL OpenStudio website. Specifically, here:

https://openstudio.nrel.gov/getting-started-developer/getting-started-radia
nce

Scroll down a tad, and you'll see a section called "Download Radiance
Binaries". We offer Windows 32-bit, MacOS Universal, and Linux 32-bit and
Linux 64-bit.

Chris Humann, I went back to dynamically linked libraries, so these won't
work for ya on OSX 10.5, sorry. There have been a bunch of updates and
fixes to a lot of the three-phase stuff for Windows, so Windows users
should definitely grab themselves a copy. This round should also fix the
Qt Rvu for many users. Please let me know if you have any difficulties
with the new packages.

Have a good weekend,

/rpg

Rob Guglielmetti
National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL)
Commercial Buildings Research Group
15013 Denver West Parkway MS:RSF202
Golden, CO 80401
303.275.4319
robert.guglielmetti at nrel.gov
subject: [Radiance-general] Updated NREL Radiance Installers are Available
